document.heading: Carnegie Casino Authorization Act of 2018
document.text: At a duly called Session of the Legislature of the Kiowa Tribe held this 22 day of January, 2018, the following Resolution and Law were adopted.

recital.text: the Legislature is vested with the authority to pass laws and resolutions pursuant to Article VI, Section 6(a) of the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe; and,
the Legislature has determined that it is in the best interests of the Tribe to authorize the reopening of the casino in Carnegie, Oklahoma, to provide jobs and revenue for the People.

recital.conjunction: NOW THEREFORE IT BE IT RESOLVED;
recital.text: that the Legislature hereby enacts the attached law entitled, "CARNEGIE CASINO AUTHORIZATION ACT OF 2018".

procedural-data.text: The foregoing Resolution KL-CY-2018-006 was duly voted upon by the Legislature on January 22, 2018, at a Session with a vote of ( 7 ) in favor and ( 0 ) opposed, ( 0 ) abstaining, and ( 0 ) absent, pursuant to the authority vested in the Legislature by the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe.
SPONSOR: Renee M. Plata, Speaker of the Legislature

CO-SPONSOR(S): Rhonda Ahhaitty, Secretary of the Legislature; Anita Onco-Johnson, Legislator; Ronald Poolaw, Sr., Legislator; Dave Geimausaddle, Legislator; Modina Waters, Legislator; Ben Wolf, Legislator

text.b: DELIVERY OF THE RESOLUTION AND LAW TO THE CHAIRMAN

procedural-data.text: Resolution No. KL-CY-2018-006, was presented to the Chairman of the Kiowa Tribe on the 25th, day of January 2018, pursuant to the Article VI, Section 8(a)(iv) of the Constitution of the Kiowa Tribe, and will become effective after signature by the Chairman or veto override by the Legislature, and as otherwise required by the Constitution.

section.heading: Short Title.
section.text: This enactment shall be known as, the "CARNEGIE CASINO AUTHORIZATION ACT OF 2017" ("Act").

para.text: The Tribe operated a casino in Carnegie, Oklahoma for many years until the Tribe and casino faced difficulties maintaining its financial and regulatory viability that forced the casino to close;

The Tribe currently operates successful casinos in two other locations, and the Legislature has determined that reopening the casino in Carnegie, Oklahoma, will benefit members of the Tribe in and around Carnegie, and will produce additional revenues for the Tribe and the People.

section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: The purpose of this Act is to authorize the Tribe to reopen and operate the casino in Carnegie, Oklahoma.

para.text: The Legislature hereby authorizes the Chairman and Kiowa Casino Operations Authority ("KCOA") to reopen and operate the casino in Carnegie, Oklahoma.
The Legislature hereby authorizes and directs the Chairman and KCOA to execute and post all necessary documents to reopen and operate the Kiowa Casino, in Carnegie, Oklahoma.

The Chairman and KCOA shall reopen, operate, and manage the casino in Carnegie, Oklahoma in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations, including but not limited to the Kiowa Tribe's Constitution, Resolutions, laws, regulations, rules, and policies, as well as the Compact with the State of Oklahoma and the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act and its implementing regulations.
